touch /root/yum-install.log yum install rsv >> /root/yum-install.log 2>&1
yum install mod_ssl >> /root/yum-install.log 2>&1 echo "cp -p /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf.orig" >> /root/yum-install.log cp -p /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf.orig echo 'sed -i -e "s#Listen 80#Listen 8000#" /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf' >> /root/yum-install.log sed -i -e "s#Listen 80#Listen 8000#" /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf echo "cp -p /etc/httpd/conf.d/ssl.conf /etc/httpd/conf.d/ssl.conf.orig" >> /root/yum-install.log cp -p /etc/httpd/conf.d/ssl.conf /etc/httpd/conf.d/ssl.conf.orig echo 'sed -i -e "s#Listen 443#Listen 8443#" /etc/httpd/conf.d/ssl.conf' >> /root/yum-install.log sed -i -e "s#Listen 443#Listen 8443#" /etc/httpd/conf.d/ssl.conf echo 'sed -i -e "s#VirtualHost _default_:443#VirtualHost _default_:8443#" /etc/httpd/conf.d/ssl.conf' >> /root/yum-install.log sed -i -e "s#VirtualHost _default_:443#VirtualHost _default_:8443#" /etc/httpd/conf.d/ssl.conf echo 'sed -i -e "s#SSLCertificateFile /etc/pki/tls/certs/localhost.crt#SSLCertificateFile /etc/grid-security/http/httpcert2.pem#" /etc/httpd/conf.d/ssl.conf' >> /root/yum-install.log sed -i -e "s#SSLCertificateFile /etc/pki/tls/certs/localhost.crt#SSLCertificateFile /etc/grid-security/http/httpcert2.pem#" /etc/httpd/conf.d/ssl.conf echo 'sed -i -e "s#SSLCertificateKeyFile /etc/pki/tls/private/localhost.key#SSLCertificateKeyFile /etc/grid-security/http/httpkey2.pem#" /etc/httpd/conf.d/ssl.conf' >> /root/yum-install.log sed -i -e "s#SSLCertificateKeyFile /etc/pki/tls/private/localhost.key#SSLCertificateKeyFile /etc/grid-security/http/httpkey2.pem#" /etc/httpd/conf.d/ssl.conf
/opt/rocks/bin/rocks add firewall host=&hostname; rulename=A20-RSV-TCP-PORT network=public service=8443 protocol="tcp" action="ACCEPT" chain="INPUT" flags="-m state --state NEW" /opt/rocks/bin/rocks report host firewall &hostname;
#!/bin/sh
THISHOST=`hostname` THISEXEC=$0 DIRNAME=`dirname $THISEXEC` CERTSDIR="&OSG_StoredCertsDir;/&hostname;"
#temporary solution (or permanent?) while figuring out #how to import certs at installation step in a secure way if [ ! -f $DIRNAME/rsvcert.pem ]; then cp -p $CERTSDIR/rsvcert.pem $DIRNAME/. fi if [ ! -f $DIRNAME/rsvkey.pem ]; then cp -p $CERTSDIR/rsvkey.pem $DIRNAME/. fi
echo "installing grid rsv certs on $THISHOST" echo "searching certs in $DIRNAME" if [ -f $DIRNAME/rsvcert.pem ]&&[ -f $DIRNAME/rsvkey.pem ]; then [ ! -d /etc/grid-security/rsv ]&& mkdir /etc/grid-security/rsv cp -p $DIRNAME/rsvcert.pem /etc/grid-security/rsv/. cp -p $DIRNAME/rsvkey.pem /etc/grid-security/rsv/. chown rsv:root /etc/grid-security/rsv/rsvcert.pem chown rsv:root /etc/grid-security/rsv/rsvkey.pem chmod 444 /etc/grid-security/rsv/rsvcert.pem chmod 400 /etc/grid-security/rsv/rsvkey.pem fi if [ -f /etc/grid-security/http/httpcert.pem ]&&[ -f /etc/grid-security/http/httpkey.pem ]; then cp -p /etc/grid-security/http/httpcert.pem /etc/grid-security/http/httpcert2.pem cp -p /etc/grid-security/http/httpkey.pem /etc/grid-security/http/httpkey2.pem chown apache. /etc/grid-security/http/http*2.pem fi
